name: Courses in Conservation Leadership 2025 ~ NCF India
description:
NCF India is offering a wonderful set of courses to address the lack of adequate formal training in inter-disciplinary conservation research and  practice, which is essential  to create a strong cadre of well-trained and motivated conservation leaders and practitioners. The courses in Conservation Leadership are meant for Indian conservation practitioners and span essential conservation skills including project planning, fund raising, monitoring and evaluation of programmes, effective stakeholder engagement, and effective communication. 
The courses aim to assist conservation practitioners in finding the best solutions to help them in their work. Read more on the courses here. 
Click here for specific course links to REGISTER NOW before 30 Nov.

name: The Trialogue Days: Planetary Health from Different Perspectives—Mind the Gap ~ Swissnex India
description:
The Trialogue Days: Planetary Health from Different Perspectives—Mind the Gap will take place from December 1 to December 5 at IISc central building. This multi- and transdisciplinary event will bring together more than 50 researchers, clinicians, journalists, and other professionals from Switzerland, Uganda, and India to discuss together how to address the new planetary health problems. 
REGISTER NOW!

name: Let's Talk Heatwaves ~ by Heat Watch India
description:
🌡️ As heatwaves become more severe and frequent, there’s an urgent need for collaborative action to address their devastating impact on communities across India. 
Heat Watch India is inviting rights-based groups, organizations, and researchers to a community-focused online session to:
📣 Share their own experiences, updates and key lessons from heatwave-related initiatives from the past year
🌍 Discuss strategies for raising awareness and building community resilience to heat waves in 2025
🤝 Brainstorm ways to collaborate and amplify collective impact.
This session will be a shared space for everyone’s voices, insights, and ideas to help shape actionable plans for the coming year.
REGISTER NOW! 
Let’s come together to build a roadmap for meaningful, community-driven action to tackle the challenges of heat waves in 2025.

name: Data Jam on Bengaluru Lakes ~ by Open City
description:
OpenCity invites you to their next Datajam on “Bengaluru Lakes” in collaboration with Citizen Matters, Biome Environment Trust, Friends of Lakes, Paani.Earth and WELL Labs. This time they are combining the datajam with an online lakes workshop on the 28th Nov 2024 at 7 PM. 
Lakes Workshop:
📅: Nov 28th, Thursday, 7 PM – 8 PM
📍: Online 
Datajam:
📅: Dec 7th 2024, 10 AM to 5 PM.
📍: Church Street, Bengaluru – 560001. 
The registration page has more details about the two events and what you can expect from each. 
Link for the workshop and details on the datajam will be sent on registering.
REGISTER NOW!

name: Rooting for Tubers ~ Spudnik Farms
description:
You don’t want to miss the 2024 Rooting for Tubers Festival! for a celebration of indigenous tuber crops, sustainable agriculture, and the diverse culinary traditions that highlight their potential. 
– Meet farmers, chefs, and food enthusiasts passionate about biodiversity
– Fun workshops and talks on tuber crops and sustainable food systems
– Creative installations and cultural performances 
Rooting for Tubers is a vibrant celebration of the incredible world of tuber crops. The goal is to spread awareness about tuber crops and brainstorm potential strategies for bringing root & tuber crops into the mainstream. Ring in the last month of the year with the second edition of the Rooting For Tubers Festival. 
BOOK TICKETS NOW!

location.name: St Johns Auditorium, Koramangala, Bengaluru, India

name: Water Testing Walk ~ by ATREE
description:
Join this walk at the Jakkuru lake – guided by Priyanka Jamwal of ATREE 
REGISTER NOW

name: Green Literature Festival ~ Benedict Parmanand
description:
The 4th Edition of Green Lit Fest is here! With a whole range of incredible workshops lined up for this year’s event – this is your chance to dive into a world of climate education, creative expression, and meaningful conversations! 
REGISTER NOW! 
The Green Literature Festival (GLF) was born when Benedict Paramanand, founder of India’s most-read SustainabilityNext e-magazine and co-founder of the Bangalore Business Literature Festival broached the idea to a team of enthusiastic writers in November 2020.. It aspires to build a robust ecosystem of green literature for readers, publishers, authors, NGOs, business bodies, public policy forums, education institutions, among others. It aims to become a multifaceted platform that amplifies the role of green literature in shaping dialogues, debates, environmental consciousness, education, and call-to-action from political, business and civil society leaders.

name: Bird Watch ~ by Early Bird
description:
Join Early Bird for a refreshing bird walk at Bengaluru’s Jakkur Lake! Explore a vibrant mix of winter migrants and resident birds, discovering their unique adaptations as the seasons shift. 
REGISTER NOW! 
Date: Sunday, 1st December, 2024
Time: 7:00-9:00 AM
Location: Jakkur Lake, Bengaluru 
Please note that this is a paid walk facilitated by Early Bird as part of The Greener Side by Echoes of Earth music festival.

name: ALL LIVING THINGS - Environmental Film Festival 2024
description:
ALT EFF’s 2024 edition marks five years of driving large-scale climate action through the power of cinema, inspiring us to understand our place and role on this shared planet.
Join the movement, take charge, and spark a ripple of change. 
The All Living Things Environmental Film Festival (ALT EFF) curates impact storytelling and experiential learning that is accessible, relevant to inspires awareness into action. Through pay-as-you-feel global online streaming & in-person community screenings, they showcase untold stories of regeneration, activism, crisis and hope. 
Bangalore screenings between November 22nd to December 4th
KEY DETAILS ABOUT #ALTEFF2024:
🎥 100+ live screening events pan-India + globally (Ireland, Chile, Costa Rica, USA)
🎥 72 films
🎥 Streaming 🌏 online 
SEE | BOOK | REGISTER at www.alteff.in

Attend the 21st Annual TN Khoshoo Memorial Lecture and Award themed, ‘Reviving India’s Ecosystems’. 
REGISTER NOW! 
The annual T N Khoshoo Memorial Award is given to an academician or a practitioner whose work has had an impact in the fields of environment, conservation, or development. The T N Khoshoo Memorial Award was started by the Khoshoo family and ATREE to honour Dr Khoshoo’s legacy. The T N Khoshoo Memorial Award and Lecture was instituted in 2004 to honour the legacy of the world-renowned environmental scientist, Dr Triloki Nath Khoshoo. Dr Khoshoo was the first Secretary of the Indian Government’s newly created Department of Environment, in 1982. He played a significant role in the development of India’s environmental policy. Dr Khoshoo was also one of the early trustees of ATREE.

location.name: Bangalore International Centre, 7, 4th Main Rd, Stage 2, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071

name: November Tree Festival ~ Season Watch
description:
Don’t miss this opportunity to celebrate the end of the year in one of the best ways possible! Season watch invites you to organize and go on tree walks around you and SeasonWatch your trees. Participate, Complete the festival challenges and win exciting prizes! 
When: 22 November – 1 December 2024 
Where: Anywhere in India! 
READ MORE about the festival challenges here!

name: Urban Ecology - a New Lens on Biodiversity
description:
We’re excited to invite you to the Urban Ecology exhibition, a collaboration with the IIHS Library and Mihir Kulkarni from the IIHS School of Environment and Sustainability.
Understanding urban ecological dynamics is crucial for developing strategies to mitigate biodiversity loss and promote nature conservation within cities and for improved sustainability. However, the process of urbanisation intertwines with social and economic factors, creating complex interactions that demand our attention. Urban ecology addresses these challenges by studying ecology in, of, and for the city. Through a series of engaging activities focussed on India, this quarter’s exhibition is curated to introduce a broader audience to this fascinating area of research. 
The curated collection of books, publications and research articles delves into the complex interactions between cities, nature, and the social factors that influence them. 
The exhibition is free and open to all; walk in and enjoy the curation. Don’t miss the dedicated corner showcasing publications from our Small Grants Programme Projects!

location.name: IIHS Bangalore City Campus, Sadashiva Nagar

description:

Application Deadline: 20 September 2024 
APPLY NOW!

name: 🔸*Beyond Right and Wrong - Youth Leadership is Changing the Game!*🔸
description:
_An Invitation by Mercy Mission Fellowship, ComMutiny_ – _The Youth Collective and the VartaLeap Coalition_ 
We are delighted to invite you to join us at a space of reimagination and rejuvenation. This dialogue is aimed at bringing together youth allies, including donors, educators, policymakers, as well as youth workers and youth leaders to unravel the knotty problems that prevent youth-centric development from being mainstreamed. 

📍*Date* : *30th November ’24, Saturday*
📍*Time* : *09:30am to 01:30pm followed by lunch*
📍*Location* : *SIMS Seminar Hall, 5th Floor, HBS Hospital, #58, Cockburn Road,ShivajiNagar, Bengaluru 5600051*

*Event Highlights* : 

🔅*Tackling Wicked Challenges* : Join fellow stakeholders to better understand the wicked challenges of youth centric development.
🔅*Take intention to action* : Commit to supporting youth leaders and invest in new ways of addressing the challenges faced by them
🔅*Support for Youth Leaders* : Four intrapreneur teams will present their bold ideas, competing for top grants to amplify climate – positive narratives. Become their allies and coaches!

REGISTER NOW! This will help make the necessary arrangement for a memorable and productive gathering. 
Please feel free to reach out to Rishad @ 94838 35482 or Shabnam @ 91760 47192
